intro: Ixia flavescens, commonly known as the yellow ox-eye, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers with white centers. The plant typically grows in well-drained soils and prefers full sun exposure. Its blooms appear in late summer to early autumn, adding vibrant color to gardens. Ixia flavescens is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for.
